reviews.text: Fantastic location, smack dab in the middle of this amazing city. While the hotel is not "charming" by any means, with two kids (6 & 3) it was the perfect small hotel for anyone traveling with kids. Family suite was all set up for us. Friendliest front desk & breakfast staff you'll ever meet.
reviews.title: Great with kids

reviews.text: Couple of notes. Our room(s) were just above Via Fillungo - a VERY busy walk street. While they have sound-proofed windows, if you're noise sensitive best to arrange for a room over the rear courtyard.
reviews.title: Friendly, Family run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, be prepared for a white-knuckled drive to the hotel for drop-off & check out. You drive down the narrow pedestrian packed Via Fillungo and can't BELIEVE that it's legal (but it is). Parking is provided nearby in a sardine-like packed garage, but you get used to it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — the steep stairs to the room - with no lift

reviews.text: Finally, you have to bike ride atop the wall...but keep your kids away from the edge.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel in overrated town

reviews.text: Hotel Lucca is smack in the center of Lucca, just steps from the main pedistrian only shopping street. From here, you can walk to all the sights, or better yet, save your feet some and rent a bike for about 12 euros a day. The hotel is very clean, comfortable beds, cool A/C. Staff is very helpful and friendly. I needed help with train schedules, and the owners son? quickly printed out a schedule for me. They also have internet at a reasonable 1euro per 10 minutes. Only negative is the rooms are a bit dark; price was a little on the high side for me at 112 Euros (without breakfast)
reviews.title: Best choice in Lucca

reviews.text: Stayed in the annex which has been updated. Typical Italian room for this price range. Nice breakfast. Friendly staff. Now with free internet access. Great location.
reviews.title: Luna has it all

reviews.text: Our triple on the second floor was enormous, with at
reviews.title: An enormous room inside the city walls

reviews.text: least a 20' frescoed ceiling. One of the largest
reviews.title: Our Stay Was Perfect

reviews.text: hotel rooms I have ever had in Europe. This may be
reviews.title: Not bad, not great - take your receipt!
Very satisfactory
reviews.text: the quad referred to in Frommer's. There is no

reviews.title: Charming little hotel in the middle of the medieval town of Lucca
reviews.text: We decided to stay over in Lucca because we had heard so much about the charming medieval town. Everyone was right! Lucca is just incredible and I will go back again. This little hotel is in a great location and has parking. We had a huge room with frescoed ceilings that was just wonderful. Lulu was our host and she was so helpful in every way. They parked our car and retrieved it for us and provided every service possible. We found a Puccini Opera Concert that evening in St. John's church which was worth every penny! This is Puccini's hometown and they celebrate his music everywhere you go. The electricity was off for a few hours when we returned from dinner, but the showed us to our room with flashlight and luckily we had a couple of candles. It was really fun!

reviews.title: overpriced, under-charming
reviews.text: this hotel is in a great location, which is what you pay for in such a relatively small town especially. the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. however, the room was kinda dank and depressing. no charm whatsoever about it, down to a sad plain grey bedspread and nothing on the walls. at 111 euros for a single it was very overpriced in my opinion. the hotel interior lacked any personality, as well. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone staying in siena.

reviews.title: Would recommend!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel La Luna for two nights, the first week of June 04. It is in a great location (close to everything), quiet, and reasonably priced. Rooms were nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would skip the optional breakfast served there because it is pricey for what you get. I concur with what other reviewers have said about Hotel Lu Luna.

reviews.title: Good Choice
reviews.text: Jonathan

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: We decided to spend a night in Lucca at the last minute and were able to get a room here because of a cancellation. The room was quiet, clean and very comfortable. Parking (an enormous problem in Lucca) was provided in a nearby garage. This is an excellent, though unexceptional, hotel. I'd gladly stay here again for the experience of being inside the walls of this lovely town.

Although this property was difficult to find, there were no 25 steps up to the reception area. It is right on ground level. (That old review must have been for a different La Luna!). This had to have been the biggest bargain of our stay ($112 euro per night in May 2007). The room was lovely and the bathroom totally adequate. I haven't been in a hotel yet in Italy that has an alarm clock, iron or coffee maker so don't look for one (or even ask!) We had total access to our cooling system. We totally had an elevator although we only had about 10 steps to our room so never used it. The staff was outstanding. They accomodated us when it was necessary for us to come a day early and stay an extra day. Not an easy thing in Italy in May. We loved the town immensely and would go again in an instant.
reviews.title: Amazing, delightful
La Luna is Lovely
reviews.text: Expatriate friends who have lived in Tuscany for over twenty years recommended this hotel for our five-day stay. This European trip for our family was a belated college graduation gift for our son, now 23. We are travelers who would rather spend money in restaurants and on local crafts than for fancy hotels with loads of extra amenities. Dealing directly with the hotel online was easy .They were able to accomodate our request, for a king bed and a single, in a room whose ceiling was so spectacular that the first thing my husband did after dropping our bags was to flop on the floor to photograph it! The bathroom was immaculate. Soaps and even a shower cap were provided. Shutters on our windows - there was even one in the bathroom - opened out onto the courtyard and the bright yellow wall of the building across the way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly and helpful - sorted out conflicting brochure information about a concert we were interested in attending, directed us to a bookstore, and were very helpful with our rental car, which they stored in their garage in advance of our arrival (we were there over Christmas when nearly everything is closed on the 25th and 26th) making it easy to get to for our early morning departure and providing directions - Lucca's streets are exceedingly narrow, many pedestrian- only. We walked everywhere - La Luna is centrally located just off the main north-south street.
reviews.title: big room, nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was simple - breads, cheese, wonderful pears - and the best proscuitto I think I've ever eaten.
reviews.title: Excellent Situation

likes.disliked: — not very easy to drive to and park but that's the same with many hotels in small tuscan towns!

reviews.title: Ideal situation
reviews.text: The only drawback - for some travelers - is that there is no elevator. We knew that ahead of time, and it was not a problem for us. We loved La Luna, and will definitely return.
